Key Match Events: Indonesia was awarded a crucial penalty ahead of half time
Substitute Le received a red card for a sliding challenge on Ferdinan in the 90th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesian defender Walsh said, 'Its a massive win for us, for all the effort we've put in the last couple of months and even the last couple of years. It's positive for us, an amazing feeling to have three points in the bag.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Abdullah bin Khalifa Stadium in Doha
Others: The win keeps the Indonesians in with a chance of qualifying for the last 16 knockout rounds
Vietnam opted for a double substitution at half time
Vietnam's best opportunity of the match came early after the break
Indonesian Captain Bahar was forced off the pitch in the 56th minute due to an injury concern
Vietnam became more frenetic and in the 90th minute substitute Le returned to the stands after receiving a red card for a sliding challenge on Ferdinan
Vietnam face group leaders Iraq but their campaign looks to be pretty much over
